unittitle.value: Pamela Schafler collection of graphic material

abstract.value: This collection consists of material donated by Pamela Schafler.  It includes correspondence and telephotographs, with a total of 7 items.

p.value: Available by advance appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org. Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)
This collection should be cited as:Pamela Schafler Collection of Graphic Material, PR 331, Department of Prints, Photographs and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.

This collection consists of material donated by Pamela Schafler, chair of the New-York Historical Society's Board of Trustees. It includes two pieces of correspondence from Jacqueline Kennedy, a photograph of President John F. Kennedy, a photograph of President Lyndon Johnson and family, and an envelope from the White House postmarked 1964. In addition, there are two telephotographs (photographs transmitted via telegraph, a process also know as phototelegraphy) from the 1930s. The telephotographs are stamped "This telephotograph was transmitted over wires of the Bell System."
